item.title: An edge case in TeX
item.description: Suppose you have the following raw TeX (not LaTeX) file first.tex: \def\mycommand{\relax First version of my command.} \input second.tex \mycommand This defines a custom macro, inputs a second file, and then prints the output of the custom macro. Suppose that second.tex contains: \def\mycommand{\relax Second version of my command.} Command has been redefined. What’s the output of pdftex first.tex? It’s what you’d expect: Command has been redefined. Second version of my command.

item.title: TeX and global variables
item.description: Suppose you have the following raw TeX (not LaTeX) file first.tex: \def\mycommand{\relax First version of my command.} \input second.tex \mycommand This defines a custom macro, inputs a second file, and then prints the output of the custom macro. Suppose that second.tex contains: \def\mycommand{\relax Second version of my command.} Command has been redefined. What’s the output of pdftex first.tex? It’s what you’d expect: Command has been redefined. Second version of my command.
